ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the self and what proportioned it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The soul and how it was integrated
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the soul and by Him Who perfectly proportioned it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and by the soul and that (Power) which designed it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the soul and by oath of Him Who made it proper.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By Nafs, and Ma Sawwaha (Who apportioned it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the soul and Him Who made it perfect,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: By the soul, and That which shaped it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And a soul and Him Who perfected it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: by the soul and how He formed it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the soul and Him Who propertioned it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by the soul and Him who fashioned it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By the Soul, and the proportion and order given to it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by Nafs (Adam or a person or a soul, etc.), and Him Who perfected him in proportion;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: by the soul and Who shaped it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the soul and He who proportioned it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [91:7] and [by] the soul, that is to say, [by] all souls, and the One Who proportioned it, in its created form (mā in all three instances relates to the verbal action, or functions as man, ‘the one who’),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And a soul and Him who perfected it) by creating it with two hands, two feet, two eyes, two ears as well as with all the other organs.
